Parking was easy, suite was beautiful, surroundings inside the hotel were very nice and clean! Breakfast was great (long lines though and not enough tables for high traffic times in the a.m.) Nice cocktail hour (could have used a little better choices for munchies!) I am looking forward to staying here again when I am in The OC!
Manager Response: Dear Madeline - thanks for taking time to share your Embassy experience.  So glad you chose to stay with us and happy to hear about your visit.  We're looking forward to your next OC visit.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Overall, the hotel is spacious, bright, clean, and in a good location (close to the airport and short drives to offices and restaurants).  Staying in room 707, however, I've heard many mechanical noises (service elevator, perhaps).  It's also a larger room, made for accessibility.
Manager Response: Dear Vbplyr - thank you for your comments and glad you found the suite accomodations spacious.  I'm not certain about the mechanical noise you experienced and have shared with our Engineering team.  I can ensure you that the staff does not use the service elevator after 10pm.  We hope to see you back at the Hotel on your next visit to Orange County.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Very good hotel and convenient to restaurants and the airport.  Hotel accommodations are well done with service to match.  I stay here frequently and walk across the street to McCormick and Schmicks. I recommend this hotel to my other business associates and opt to fly out of SNA instead of LAX as a result.
Manager Response: Dear Robert - thank you for your continued loyalty and I cant agree with you more about the ease of Orange County County Airport (SNA).  Please let us know what we can do to move your four star experience to five stars.  Also really appreciate you bringing fellow associates to the Hotel.  That's huge!  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Had a great stay on a last minute family vacation for the weekend.  The rooms were nicely sized and the separate rooms and comfy bed made for a very nice stay.  And the breakfast with made to order omelettes really could not be beat.
Manager Response: Dear Wesley S - so great to hear about your last minute fantasic stay at the Embassy Suites Irvine.  We're open 52 weekends out of the year so hope to have you back real soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: This is the third time we have stayed at this Embassy Suites.  As always, it was a very good value for the price. Our room was in very good shape.  The staff was friendly, quick and efficient. The complimentary breakfast was very good as well.  Our only real complaint this trip was parking.  We had booked as part of a group that had negotiated $8 per night parking, rather than the normal $15 per night.  However, they charged us $15 anyway.  To add insult to injury, there was no parking.  The parking garage was totally full when we got back on Saturday night.  This was despite the fact that they had tried to make more spots in the garage by making several spots ridiculously narrow, and marking them "compact."  There were three or four cars circling looking for spots. If I am
Manager Response: Dear AGuyFromArizona  - thank you for taking the time to let us know about your most recent stay and so glad to hear that great comments about the accommodations, staff and breakfast.  I'm sorry to hear about you parking challenges and I'll send a private message with my contact info to further discuss the charge.  The garage can get quite full on weekends; however, we do overflow into the other side of the structure which has more than 500 additional spaces.  Sounds like we may have just been late in getting the overflow signage in place and I do apologize for that.  We hope to see you back at the Hotel on your next trip to California.  Best regard, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: My 2nd morning at this hotel, I went down for breakfast to the Omelette bar and had a rather rude encounter with the chef.  He was aggressive with not only myself, but other patrons.  I went to management and explained what had occurred, not knowing if they would take it seriously.  They did.  That night I had a bottle of wine and a fruit/cheese platter in my room provided by Vanessa Martinez, Exec. Meeting Mgr.  The next morning I was approached by management who made sure everything was going well.  My entire team heard about this fantastic customer service and enjoyed the wine and platter with me.  Way to go Embassy Suites.
Manager Response: Dear Adam M, thank you for taking time to let us know about your experience.  First of all I want you to know that your encounter has been discussed with our F&B team and that is not what we expect as a service standard.  I'm so glad Vanessa on our sales team was able to intervene and to "Make it Right" is our pledge for guest satisfaction.  We hope to see you back really soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I travel a lot for work and am a Hilton property lover.  This is one of the best Embassy Suites I have stayed in thus far.  I have not stayed in them all though.  I would definitely stay again.  The room service food is not so good.  I had the New york strip, fish and chips and shrimp ...not too good.  But great and friendly staff.
Manager Response: Dear Brenda O, thank you for your recent stay and taking time to share your thoughts.  I'm sorry to hear the room service was not to your liking and I'm happy to share that we are in process of a full menu renovation for both the Ha'Penny and room service.  We're looking forward to your next stay and delivering a great dinning experience.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: This is our go-to hotel in the Irvine area. The hotel is located close to the airport, restaurants and shopping. A very relaxing atmosphere. The complimentary breakfast and evening reception are excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Robert K - we love that the Embassy Suites Irvine is your go to Oasis.  Thanks for sharing and we are looking forward to your next stay.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Surprised that Embassy is charging internet access per device rather than by room.  Beware!  Most of us have multiple devices so be prepared. Also, appalled by cleanliness of hidden places...the pull out sofabed!  Crumbs and candy under the cushions...REALLY?
Manager Response: Dear Michael A, thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  I've shared your comments with our Housekeeping Manager and that is definitely not our standard.  Regarding the Internet, because each device has it's own mac address the system recognizes and charges per individual device.  Any more than one charge per 24 hour period on your room should have been adjusted at the front desk.  If that did not happen, I'm happy to speak with you further and resolve this.  I will be sending you my email in a private message.  I hope that if you are returning to Irvine that you will give us a second chance.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I thought the overall experience was good, the only problem i saw was the parking and getting in and out.  The room was great, the food was good.  I would recommend this hotel. I left my kindle and they retrieved it and set it aside for me to pick up.
Manager Response: Dear Janice D, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  I'm so glad to hear about your experience and especially that we were able to get your Kindle back to you.  We're hoping to see you back at the Hotel really soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel for many years.  Even though it's starting to look a bit worn in the common areas, the rooms are incredibly roomy and comfortable.  The only challenge is recently there's been some conflict with employees (I'm guessing union) and protesters with bullhorns yell in front of the hotel being careful not to step on the property.  Even so, it's annoying as my room was far from the front of the property and I could still here them.  One day they woke me up at 6:30 with their yelling.  They also tend to yell at you when you leave the property.  Even so, its convenient location and comfort outweighs the negative.
Manager Response: Dear kcmb813, thank you for your continued loyalty to the Embassy Suites Hotel.  Happy to share that we have some upcoming capital projects for the public areas including all new guest corridor carpeting and wall covering.  It is always our goal to deliver superior service and room product.  I'm sorry the local union folk tried to disturb your stay.  They are not employees, rather paid agitators and their end goal is to increase due paying membership.  We have been a happy non-union hotel since 1986 and they do not represent our associates in any means.  We've actually offered a NLRB vote on more than one occasion and they've turned it down.  Please feel free to call my office on your next stay if there's anything I can do to make your stays even better.   Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Needs a lot of improvements and never again.
Summary: Well, where to start, first and for most, it seem that almost every day, just after 7am, protesters show up with bullhorns (electric type ) and blast there "message" about said hotel.  Not a problem unless you need to sleep for a late checkout for work.  Front desk said zip about it on check in and did Nothing on check out.  Just a simple "sorry". Mind you this has been going on for over a year! Also, their computer systems is down between the restaurant and front desk.  Hence cash or CC, and it can't go on your room and you lose the points.   Third, you get a lot of "sorry" and little action.  I could go on, whoever, there is not enough room to do so.  Never again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Always love staying at this location. Feels like my home away from home. Hotel staff quickly acknowledges me and provides hotel features quickly. Food is hot and delicious. I always stay at this location when in the Orange County area.
Manager Response: Dear Angus E, thank you for your continued loyalty and for allowing us to be your home away from home.  We hope to see you back in Irvine really soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Very relaxing place to stay on your business trip.  Tiny negative, bring a mouse pad, the glass top work table won't work with optical mice. The shop was out of washing soap, they placed a full sized box in the laundry, to keep the inconvenience away.
Manager Response: Dear Opus1617 - Thanks for commenting about your stay with us in August.  Good tip on the mouse pad and if travel brings you back to Orange County I;ve got a couple extra in my office for you.  Glad you had a great stay and we hope you'll be back.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Good service - nice big rooms, great breakfast!
Summary: Demea is great and very helpful for consistent business travel.  Front desk can be flakey, but overall service is above average.  Great location near the airport, major highways, shopping and food.  Breakfast is very good - with an omelet station - bar isn't too bad either.
Manager Response: Dear Judge779, thank you for your recent review and I'm thrilled to pass on your comments to Demea.  We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to your next visit.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Management was very responsive and went out of their way to remedy a circumstance that was beyond their control.  Was very pleased with the room and the hotel overall.  Would definitely stay there in the future if in the area again.
Manager Response: Dear Susan S, thank you for your comments and allowing us to "Make it Right" on your recent stay.  We look forward to welcoming you back very soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: I stay at the Embassy Suites, Irvine CA often and it is consistently fantastic!
Summary: This hotel has a great staff and amenities. Their cook to order breakfast is fantastic (and free!) as is their nightly open bar (also free!). Their employees really make the difference though. I have been coming here for a while and everyone knows my name and I've come to know most of theirs. They genuinely seem to like their jobs and ensuring that guests have a good stay. I strongly recommend this hotel for any travel to the area, including if you are going to Disney, have an upcoming youth sporting event, etc..
Manager Response: Dear Dwayne L, thank you for your comments and your loyalty to the Hotel.  I'll be certain to pass on your enthusiasm for our complimentary breakfast.  We look forward to seeing you on your next trip.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: This hotel is 5 minutes from Orange county airport, parking can be a hassle if you arrive very late. The front desk had checked me in wrong name and billed me twice, but otherwise  a good hotel with very good breakfast options.Had a good stay!
Manager Response: Dear Praveen, thank you for your recent comments and good to hear our location is a plus for airport travelers.  I apologize for the billing error and glad that it was resolved.  We look forward to your next stay and breakfast experience at the Embassy Suites Irvine.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Stay at this hotel in the past. Good location -close to airport and easy exit to freeways.Only complain is the snack and drinks at the afternoon reception is very limited.During our stay of 3 days, housecleaning was very accomodating to our sleeping in late. However, the second and third day a large group of soccer parents and kids arrived and cause a lot of noise by running around screaming and yelling. Kids, I understand---but from the parents???? In the future, management should oversee these kind of behaviour a little bit more closer. Another problem we encounter on the last day was there was not enough parking space in the garage for all the guest. We have to park on the street and was also charge for that night.All-in all, We will probably stay at this hotel again in our
Manager Response: Dear William L, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  I was glad to hear we were able to afford you a little extra sleep and we look forward to welcoming yo back to the Hotel.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I stayed here with my son from August 4-9 while he was competing at the Jr. Nationals at Irvine High School.  It was very convenient to the pool - maybe 10 minutes tops.  I had no trouble checking in.  I am a Hilton Honors member and my room was ready despite my arriving early.  I have stayed at other Embassy Suites and I knew what to expect.  In fact, I chose this hotel so that we would have the added space of a living room since we were going to be there for 6 days.  The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable.  The fridge was a little smaller than other Embassy Suites I have stayed at and I could have really used the extra room, but it was great to have a fridge at all.  We did have an issue with the air the first day.  They sent maintenance up right away and he got
Manager Response: Dear Ctribbs, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  We had a lot of people for the Jr, Nationals and so glad to hear our location and amenities was just what you were looking for.  We hope if you are returning to Orange County that we'll see you again.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: The old building but refreshed rooms
Summary: In some circumstances E. Suites hotels seem to really cater to the business traveler and others seem to work hard to fiill the weekend rooms with families and events.  This really does change the vibe of the hotel.  While we were there it was clearly college weekend since a big swim and water polor competition was taking place nearby.  What this hotel did better than others we've experienced is to control the noise level when the masses turn out for breakfast or in the evening.  The open center design (the "old design" I mentioned above) is great but with the right /wrong mix of people it can be incredibly noisy in the whole hotel.  This was not the case - which is saying something with a college crowd.  Similar to other E.S. properties the staff was really good overall.
Manager Response: Dear SFWorld, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  I'm certainly glad you had a very enjoyable stay and the location was convienent.  Orange County hosts many sporting events including the recent water polo and swimming championships you experienced.  We do add extra security to help manage these high occupancy days.  Each summer Embassy Suites promotes "Catch me at my best" were guests and associates are encourage to recognize great service and hard work.  This summer we celebrated associates with the most catches by letting them fish for ducks and prizes.  The extra large ducks have also been a hit with guests so just adding 12 more and I think they are here to stay!  We look forward to welcoming you back to see the ducks again soon.  Best regards, Ken

Summary: Business travel.  Suite was spacious and quiet.  Good bed.  Great breakfast.  Small pool and fitness room.  Evening reception - good drinks , poor food.  Helpful staff and attractive atrium.  Pricey but it is California and close to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your most recent stay and glad we we could accommodate your business needs.  We hope your business brings you back to the Hotel again and appreciate your positive comments.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Not bad.  Not good.   Just ok
Summary: It's ok.  The bathroom and the shower could be better.   I have stayed here a few times.  It's the closest Hilton prop. To where I work here.   Parking is a zero.  It's terrible.    The showers are not good if you are taller than five foot two.    It's pretty clean.  Not as clean as I would hope.   But not as bad as some other places I have stayed.
Manager Response: Dear markos314, thank you for your comments on your most recent stay and your Hilton loyalty.  I'm glad to hear our location works well for your business needs and when you are returning please feel free to contact me directly if there's anything I can do to make your stay even better.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites is good, year after year
Summary: I've stayed at lovely, expensive hotels all over the world, but when I have to spend my own money I often look for Embassy Suites, and this one was just as good as all the others. Room 809 was perfect, quiet, very fast wireless internet. Glass of wine in the evening, and breakfast in the morning were great. Nice shuttle to the airport. Nice streets around the hotel for an early morning walk.
Manager Response: Dear ksmithderm, thank you for your recent stay and loyalty to the Embassy Suites brand.  We're glad to be part of the family since 1986 and delivering superior guest results.  I'm glad our location worked well for you and hope to see you back at the Hotel in the near future.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: An Xlnt Hotel Except for Charging for Pitiful Mediocre WiFi
Summary: Our room was xlnt, had all the necessary xtras, frig, xtra mirrors, TV's, hair dryer, etc.,etc. Check in was quick, the free Happy Hour was nice, there is a pleasant bar/lounge off the courtyard, so we had a grand time except for the wifi. This hotel charges $7.95 extra for 24 hours of mediocre wifi connection ( weak, erractic, drops, etc.,etc.). When today it is so easy to provide xlnt wifi connection, to charge extra for pitiful wifi is an outrage. It's as if the current management is living in the Dark Ages. Until we read a TA review that they have upgraded the wifi we won't be back.
Manager Response: Dear Parkinsd, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  We are glad to hear you found the accommodations and suite amenities excellent.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: My obvious complaint is that I stayed here for 14 days and 3 times during the stay, there were protestors outside of the hotel as early as 7am.  They wake you up with bullhorns and obnoxious noises.  I can understand this may happen, but threee times and no apology from the hotel is quite absurd.  Don't get me wrong, the room was very nice, the lobby looked up to date, breakfast was adequate.  But, with the protestors, stay somewhere else.  There are many other similar properties near by.  Spend the extra money and wake up to your alarm instead of bullhorns outside your window.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, just fell short on service
Summary: We booked two rooms at this hotel as we had two seperate families going on out trip. When we arrived, the staff changed our reservations and placed the two families in the Presidential Suite, because they over-booked. The staff was unable to reverse the reservation as they had already booked the original two rooms we had reserved. The Presidential Suite was nice, don't get me wrong, but was an inconvenience to both families. Overall ammendities were nice.
Manager Response: Dear Greg R, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  I apologize that we had an issue with your reservations and I know the stay wanted to do their best to accommodate you with the presidential suite.  If you are returning to the Orange County area please feel free to contact me and I would be more than happy to assist you with future plans.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel for Business, Parking is the only hiccup
Summary: I was in Orange County for business and this hotel was fantastic and across the street from my meetings.  The rooms were spotless.  The breakfast was better than other Embassy Suites.    Great in every way other than the parking is expensive and tight.
Manager Response: Dear Brian L, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  We're glad the Hotel was so convenient for your business travel and that breakfast was enjoyable.  We hope to see yu back at the Hotel on your next trip to Orange County.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: This is a beautiful and well-maintained hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The suite had a large-screen TV in both rooms. Beds were comfortable. The hotel offers a free breakfast--eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, fruit, cereal. You can also order an omelette or other items cooked to order. Because the breakfast closes at 9:00, however, the buffet gets really crowded. I'm talking NY subway crowded. Otherwise, this was a fine place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear DaytonDave, thank you for your recent stay and comments.  We're glad you enjoyed the Hotel and our breakfast service.  If travels bring you back to Orange County we hope you choose to stay with Embassy again.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Not clean, needs to be remodeled AGAIN A/C is terrible
Summary: The breakfast is great and the rooms at large. But there are kids running around screaming everywhere. The hotel needs remodeled badly, even though it was partially done.  Someone in our party had a dirty shower with hair everywhere and hair in his sheets, from the last guest. The floor and furniture are stained. And they don't clean well. Shuttle service is spotty. Don't stay here unless you have a bunch of kids and need breakfast.  The pool is disgusting and it's indoor. The ac barely worked.
Manager Response: Dear DaytonDave, thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  Please note that all comments are discussed with the entire management team.  The Hotel has a preventive maintainance program in place and suites are continuously taken out of inventory for service.  I apologize that we missed the mark during your stay and please know that we are committed to provide the best accommodations.  If you are returning to the area please feel free to contact me directly if I can help with travel plans.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I arrived at the hotel at 10:00 PM to find that they had over booked and my guaranteed late reservation was not honored. All local hotels were full, so had to drive 45 minutes to find another place to sleep or sleep in my car.  While in lobby I saw that I was not the only person searching for a room. The hotel manager was apologizing and was professional. I actually felt sorry for her that she had to tell customers arriving to the front desk that their reservations would not be honored.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay. Located near the areas we plannded on visiting and access to freeways was simple. Room was very clean and quiet. Food and drinks great as always at Embassy Suites. Wonderful staff that were very pleasant and professional.
Manager Response: Dear Steve C, we are delighted that you had such a great stay with us at the Hotel and hope when you are in the area again we'll be seeing you at the Hotel.  Best regards, Ken

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice, Rooms decent, Customer Service Out of this world.
Summary: This was the first Embassy Suites for me. What an experience. The inside of this hotel if very nice. The rooms have been renovated recently but still show their age with the shower head height. The managers reception was nice, the breakfast was fantastic. The real clincher that made me a loyal Embassy Suites customer was the amazing customer service at this location.  The employees were extremely helpful. The managers came around every night at the reception and every morning at breakfast to make sure we were happy with everything. FANTASTIC!
Manager Response: Dear 66ninetyeightls, thank you so much for staying with us at the Hotel and great to hear you had such a great Embassy Suites experience with us at the Hotel.  I hope you'll be stying again with us next time you travel to Orange County and at any of the 200+ Embassy Suites throughout the country.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: This is my favorite hotel when I'm in town for business. I can walk to my office after a cooked to order breakfast, included with the stay. The free shuttle goes to The District where a variety of restaurants are available. The shuttle also has airport pickup.  This time of the year there are a lot of youth sports teams in the hotel. I was there for 8 nights. The housekeeping staff needs to clean the threshold to the elevator which had candy, etc in for my entire stay. That's the only negative. There is also a labor dispute with the housekeeping staff so I was greeted some mornings by protesters with bullhorns.
Manager Response: Dear SCM1955, thank you for making the Embassy Suites Irvine you choice for Hotels when in town for business.  We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to your next stay.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks on a business trip and it fit the bill for that trip.  The breakfast was good, the room was standard fare for an Embassy Suites. The location was ideal for me as I needed to go to an office within walking distance.  The housekeeping was inconsistent both as to the time when they cleaned my room and as to how well they cleaned the room, what they disposed of, etc.  In addition, the exercise room is too small, it has a couple of treadmills, elipticals and one recumbent bike.  The one time I went there (5 a.m.) the only machine available was the bike.   The first weekend of my stay the place was overrun with out of control children visiting for a softball tournament.  I am not sure there was much the hotel could do since the parents were spending
Manager Response: Dear PLW1358  - thank you for taking time to share your experience and we certain appreciate your two week stay.  I'm sorry I somehow missed responding to you sooner.  I wanted you to know that I've shared your comments (as we do with all comments) with the operations team and will certainly look at room for improvement.  Summer is a very busy time for Irvine and our Hotel included.  We do increase staff and security to manage the high occupancy.  Really glad to hear the location within walking distance worked well for you and hope to see you back at the Embassy Suites if business brings you this way.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: This is a good hotel for business, but for family on holidays to have a couple of days escape it is not the best if you need some quiteness. We needed quiteness to get away from the city.  I was hoping to go to the pool and it was full. Hope they can get bigger pools at least for weekenders.  Only because everyone uses this Hotel for family weekends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and comments.  We are a very popular destination for families and youth sporting events so weekends can be very busy.  We add extra staffing to ensure that we are meeting all guest expectations and satisfaction.  We hope to see if back a the Embassy Suites next time your travels bring you back to Orange County.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites in Irvine Strike Out
Summary: Terrible experience. We were rudely woken up at 6am by striking employees who were picketing, yelling, and using loud speakers. The police showed up and did nothing. The hotel also did nothing. This had been going on for days before and they didn't even warn us when we checked in. We got little sleep and were exhausted the next day of our vacation, ruining our plans. The hotel did NOTHING to make it right, barely even apologizing. No credit or refund was offered. Worst customer service and hotel experience of my husband I's traveling life.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is right off the 405 and close to both Newport and Huntington Beach. The parking structure had  low clearance so, if your vehicle is raised you may need to park outside. Reception was great. Breakfast was a bit crowded but, the food was good. Overall, exactly was you expect when you stay at Embassy Suites.
Manager Response: Dear Noel P, thank you for choosing the Embassy Suites Irvine on your recent visit and glad that you found the location and services up to your expectations.  We hope when travel brings you back to Orange County or you're just looking for a weekend beach escape that you'll be staying with us again.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Great things about this hotel/location? entire staff is professional/friendly.  Rooms are suites that include a microwave/refridge, fluffy towels, compfy beds, fantastic free breakfast (cook to order omelets,  pancakes, French toast, yummy pastries, fresh fruit, home fries, good coffee, juice. and a happy hour with snacks. We traveled with our team of 20 teenage baseball players, other teams filled up the Embassy Suites.  Security  made sure all stayed in control.  Things to consider; indoor small pool (beach is short 8 miles drive,) only 2 washer/dryers (big deal if traveling with sports teams~ smelling uniforms need washed daily!
Manager Response: Dear luv2travelwithkidz , thank you for bringing your young atheletes and staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine.  We're glad the Hotel worked well for the team and you enjoyed the yummy breakfast.  Hope to see you next July.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: A few flaws but nice hotel
Summary: I tend to go back to hotels I like. I am a part time free lance writer and find I can write better in the peace of a hotel room.   The front desk staff is always friendly and cheerful. They accommodate requests quickly.   I get a two room suite when I stay. This time the only two room available was directly across from the elevator. I was a bit worried, but there were no problems at all. I could hear a few dings when the elevator was on the floor, but no other problems. The elevator does take a long time to arrive, plan on a few minutes waiting.   I stayed the fourth of July, and was delighted that the view from the eight floor afforded me a beautiful view of the entire Irvine skyline's firework display.   The room was clean, and neat. The sofas seem a little dated, made out of
Manager Response: Dear Jessicarbt , thank you for making us your "go to Hotel" when traveling to Orange County.  I appreciate your comments and wanted to let you know that we are beginning a project to recover the suite sleeper sofas.  Although they are just over a year old from our recent renovation the material is wearing to our standards.  Over the next few months every sleeper sofa will be re-upholstered with a new better quality fabric.  Thanks and looking forward to your next stay.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I was traveling with the group on 15 families, and we received  outstanding service from booking our rooms with Jasmine Stewart, to check out time with Jimmy at the front desk. Jasmine was friendly, fun, professional, attentive, and a real pleasure to work with. We could not have been more pleased with the entire experience we had with the hotel. Sarah at the front desk consistently provided excellent service. From someone who works in the industry, I know how challenging it can be to work with large groups, however Embassy Suites team assisted in every step of the way.
Manager Response: Dear Dzejna S, thank you for staying with us at the Hotel and your kind comments for our team members, Jasmine and Jimmy.  We're glad the Hotel was able to exceed your groups expectations and hope to have you back really soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: My daughter and I stated at this hotel for week June 19-26.  Overall, very nice hotel and very close to hotel.  Although, I had car reservations, the company I booked through was out of vehicles for my late arrival.  I arrived before the hotel stop time for free shuttle; so, that was very nice to have that at h even though John Wayne Airport only couple miles away.  This made it very convenient.  Very nice area.  Love the OC!  Only few problems with room cleanliness and missed my room cleaning one day even though I didn't have "Do Not Disturb" on door.  Housekeeping rectified immediately, however.  Overall cleanliness of hotel very good.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Californiadreamin55, I'm glad you and your daughter had an enjoyable stay at the Hotel and we hope when you next return to Orange County that you will be staying at the Embassy Suites again.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Amazing stay for travel or families!
Summary: I was traveling with my family and with my basketball team for tournaments in Long Beach and Irvine.  We received outstanding service from trying to book our rooms all the way to post checkout.  I had very tricky means to pay and reserve rooms through our school district and the hotel processed the paperwork and was extremely timely in everything they did.  The hotels were a great deal for us as we could put more than 4 players in each room and my family of 6 was very comfortable.  The security was very good and the rooms were very quiet!  The best part for our players aside from the pool and hot tub was the made to order breakfast!  They also enjoyed free appetizers and Shirley temples during the evening.  It was a great deal for our team and my family loved the accommodations
Manager Response: Dear Bluhorshu, we're so glad you choose to bring your basketball team this summer to the Embassy Suites Irvine.  Our comp breakfast staff does an awesome job 7 days a week and glad the team loved it.  We hope next time you are in the area for a tournament that you will choose to stay with us again.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I was very impressed with this hotel. It's location is so convenient to restaurants, airport,beaches,business area. The staff is extremely friendly and courteous. The room is very large and comfortable.  It is also an excellent value. I strongly recommend this excellent hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Dan s, thank you for staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine and so happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations and the location was just perfect.  We hope to see you back again int he near future.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: For both business and leisure, this hotel exceeded my expectations. Staff was very helpful/hospitable and always with smiling faces. They offer complimentary breakfast and a managers reception nightly - both great quality and great value.
Manager Response: Dear Jaco V, thank you for staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine and awesome to hear that the accommodations and staff exceeded your expectations.  We look forward to see you back at the Hotel.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Room was clean.  Breakfast was very good and not too crowded. Would have preferred for parking to be included but a separate charge. Stayed in the handicapped suite. No complaints.  Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Michael G, thank you for staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine.  Glad to hear you had an enjoyable stay and we look forward to having you back.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I just stayed here the week of June 17th, and everything was great except for one issue: every morning at between 6am and 7am a group of protestors gathers outside the front of the hotel and uses bullhorns to wake up all the guests.   I won't go into what they are protesting, but if you are like me you will not appreciate being woken up by people yelling through bullhorns, or being yelled at as you drive past them when you leave the hotel. Not cool.   I realize the hotel is not to blame for this issue, but anyone staying there should be aware of it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a great hotel, everyone was so nice and made us feel very welcome!! Jeremy in the bar was so awesome, he always remembered my grand daughters and made them the best shirley temples!!! They really loved him... Will for sure go back and stay again...
Manager Response: Dear Julie R, thank you for staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine.  I was sure to let Jeremy know that your daughter loves the Shirley Temples.  So glad you had a wonderful stay with us and hope to see you back again soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: clean and big room.   showers-- are terrible.  i'm 5'11'' and the shower hit me mid chest area.  this can easily be fixed with a $7 part.    fire alarm went off every time i took a shower due to a little steam (very little--mirror wasn't even fogged up.
Manager Response: Dear markos314, thank you for the feedback on the showers.  I will certainly share your comments with our cheif engineer.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near SNA
Summary: The exterior of the hotel appeared well kept. (The portico area is oddly situated such that you may have some difficulty negotiating it with a larger vehicle.)  No problems with the staff, everyone I dealt with was friendly and accommodating.  The shuttle to and from the airport is fast and free which  was a very significant factor in my choosing this hotel.  Check in was efficient, and my HHonors was noted as "on file." I was given a room on the top floor.  The room was nice, but had a  disturbing number of mirrors in the room.  One of the walls in the  living room area was completely covered in mirrors.  More mirrors above  the wet bar area and two more in the bedroom.  There were plenty of  electrical outlets for charging things.  I had a room with a single king bed.  On each
Manager Response: Dear ewenix , thank you staying with us this summer and very happy to hear the the location and hotel worked out so well for your travel.  We hope to see you back again soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: My husband and I come to this Embassy Suites all the time.  It's almost our home away from home.  Everyone is extremely nice and the food in the Ha'Penny is always on point. Can't wait to come again!! Thanks,
Manager Response: Dear Christy, thank you for the kind review and we look forward to your next visit.  Make sure to be on the lookout for new Daily Specials in the Ha’Penny!  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Good, Convenient Location to Stay in Irvine
Summary: The staff are very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are clean and quiet.  Internet access, work out facility, pool, spa, complementary breakfast, managers evening reception are very good!  Always enjoy my stay here for business.
Manager Response: Dear Mark, thank you for the kind review and we look forward to your next visit.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Currently undergoing construction in their parking garage and utilizing a neighboring garage.  Yet they still charge $15.00 per day for parking even though you have to put up with the hassle of finding the alternate garage and paging security every time you want to exit.  I'd be okay with this if they gave me a break on the parking fee.  Also, my company has a corporate contract with them which includes free wi-fi, but they charged me for it and when I complained, they dragged their feet until I was forced to leave in order to catch my flight.
Manager Response: Dear Ken, thank you for the feedback and I apologize for any inconvenience you experienced while the parking structure was being painted.  I’m happy to report that the project was complete.  I’ve sent you a private message regarding the Internet charge and look forward speaking with you.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: The good:  Fantastic service, wonderful staff, clean and well maintained.  I found myself wondering why I hadn't been actively seeking out Embassy Suites to stay at on my business trips.  The bad:  Absolutely terrible beds, and 1990's internet.    Now I know why I don't stay there on my business trips.
Manager Response: Dear Graeme, thank you for the feedback.  The staff takes great pride in taking care of the Hotel, our guests and delivering great service.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Everything promised was delivered, as promised.  The staff was courteous and helpful.  The room was clean, and everything worked.  The complimentary breakfast was great.  The line for the complimentary cocktails was long, with only one bartender mixing drinks, but they let you order a couple of drinks at a time, so it wasn't necessary for us to wait in the line twice.
Manager Response: Dear Brock, thank you for your recent stay and great comments.  We hope to see you back at the Hotel soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: We stayed one night in this hotel.  Nice rooms, generous evening reception, nice staff, comfortable bed, good coffee in the morning.  But at about 6am, we were awakened to the sounds of an apparent picket line at the entrance/exit to the hotel.  Complete with a bullhorn.  Really a shame, since our stay until that point had been enjoyable.  While the picketers did not block our exit from the hotel, it was disconcerting.  So we will seek out alternatives in the Irvine area for future stays.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My niece is getting married tonight and selected Embassy Suites to spend their wedding night.  The proximity to the wedding location was a huge deciding factor.  From the moment we made the reservation the entire staff has been completely accommodating!  They have flagged her reservation for an early check-in so she can get ready (based on availability).  I am confident they will pull through.   I just called to have a special amenity delivered while they prepare for the wedding.  Liberty in the food & beverage department has literally brought me to joyous tears!  I wanted something special but non-alcoholic.  Liberty suggested chocolate covered strawberries and sparkling cider sent.  Please keep in mind, they do not have sparkling cider on property BUT she will make sure it
Manager Response: Dear Dedarox, thank you for your recent stay and the amazing comment regarding our associate Liberty.  I was thrilled to share your comment with her and glad we had an opportunity to deliver on our service promise.  Hope to see you back at the Hotel soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: A one night stay, but a nice stay.
Summary: We stayed at this Embassy Suites during a road trip to visit Catalina Island.  After driving from the Phoenix area we were looking for a quiet, comfortable hotel close enough to Dana Point that we could catch the ferry the next morning.  Our check-in was prompt and courteous and we were quickly on our way to our room.  We went downstairs for an evening cocktail and a bite to eat and were surprised to see a high school band that had just arrived from Disneyland checking in.  The staff did an amazing job getting them and their chaperones quickly off to their rooms, and even with a haotel full of teenagers our room was quiet and we had a great nights' sleep.  The location is great, between I-5 and I-405, near the John Wayne airport and in the middle of the high tech area.  I would
Manager Response: Dear AZToolman, thank you so much for your recent stay and nice comments.  We are glad that you found us convenient for your Catalina trip and hope to have you back maybe for a full weekend next time you are in town.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Overall, a good ES property. Staff was helpful and attentive, reception was good, breakfast typical ES quality.  The room condition was good if showing its age, but somehow I think the bed was not as comfortable as most.   Five minutes to the airport, and they have a free shuttle.
Manager Response: Dear, Ken.  Thank you for your recent stay and nice comments.  We are glad our Hotel was a good central location for your travels and hope to have you back again on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel and Atmosphere but SEVER NEEDS RETRAINING
Summary: Hotel atmosphere was REALLY nice, I always love the fact that they have made to order omelets, cooked with too much butter though. Mgr reception was nice, room was clean. The arrival experience was nice. It was our anniversary and they wrote a personalized note and provided complimentry dessert and beverages coupons. BAD-server refused to let us use them for Alcohol, never offered to get the mgr, tried to get us to purchase and even made us feel as if we produced them in our ROOM. Husband had to get MGR to straighten it out. TURNS OUT WE COULD USE THEM FOR ALCOHOL! WOW-GET RETRAINED
Manager Response: Dear Deon.  Thank you for your recent stay and nice comments.  I apologize for the service in the bar and have discussed with the Food & Beverage team.  I hope if you are in the area again that you will keep us in consideration and know that your message was heard.

Summary: This is the type of hotel you want if you are looking for peace and tranquility. Although it is close to the airport, I never heard one plane.  The made to order omelets are some of the best I have had and the whole breakfast was great.  The rooms are big and roomy and very relaxing. You couldn't find much better for the money!
Manager Response: Dear Kcmacgiver, thank you for your recent stay and so happy you had a chance to relax in peace and tranquility.  At Embassy Suites we love breakfast and glad you enjoyed.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Hotel In Irvine, CA
Summary: Very nice hotel. It is close to every upscale and low scale restaurant. From McD's to Morton's Steakhouse. The evening social is very nice. You can choose from the cantina quite a variety of adult beverages. Also, the breakfast in the morning has everything you can ever want. The rooms are really nice too. You are close to shopping, Disneyland, Knott's and the Orange County Airport.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle, thank you for the great comments and so glad you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to see you back at the Hotel soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Comfortable at the end of the day
Summary: One of the best things about any Embassy Suites is the ability to relax in your own living space before going to bed.    This property is typical of the usual ES quality.  It was well appointed, had great views and was in an exceptionally convenient and safe area of Irvine.  Great made to order breakfast - even serving crepes some mornings.    The negatives - The couch was a little stained, (other than that the room was very clean). The food in the restaurant was fair and like most hotels, overpriced.  The French onion soup was wonderful, The Rueben was a good choice, ribs - okay, coleslaw that came with it was wilted and bland. for $4.95 you can get a sparse piece of supermarket cheesecake - don't bother it tastes like the cooler.   There is a WONDERFUL Mexican restaurant 1/2
Manager Response: Dear Pilgrimx, thank you for the comments and glad to hear you had an enjoyable stay.  I'm happy to report that all the suite couches are being re-upholstered very shortly.  Although the sofas are just over a year old, the fabric is not wearing to the standard we expect.    Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: The managers reception was a great way to relax in the evening and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The complimentary breakfast was also pretty good.  The hotel is also located just five minutes from John Wayne Airport so it couldn't be any more convenient.  My shuttle driver was very friendly and kind.  Overall, it was a great experience with great service.
Manager Response: Dear David, thank you for your recent stay and very happy to hear that you found our Managers Reception a great time to relax.  We hope to see you again soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Our Basketball team stayed here for a tournament.  The rooms were large and clean, the staff was very nice and the laundry room was clean and functional.  The breakfast buffet had plenty of items to choose from for all parties.
Manager Response: Dear guest, we are so pleased that the team enjoyed the Hotel.  Our spacious suites are always a big hit with family travel.  We hope to see the team back again next time your in town for a tournament.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Last week my family and I spent a week visiting relatives in Orange County and had the pleasure of staying in the Embassy Suites-Irvine-Orange County Airport. The accommodations were excellent and the staff was very courteous, helpful and genuinely friendly. We were impressed with the breakfasts that were served as well as with the Manager’s happy hour. We were particularly impressed with the General Manager,  Swietlana Cahill who we observed being exceptionally helpful and friendly to everyone that she came in contact with. We saw her personally greet and hug everyone one in the long line of room attendants that were coming in for their morning exercises. She was also involved in preparing the breakfasts and we loved her specialty,  Russian crepes. I asked her if she was
Manager Response: Dear Robert W.  It was a delight to read your review and how great your stay was.  Swietlana does make an excellent Russian crepe.  We hope you and your family will be returning again to see the relatives and staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Large rooms and delicious made to order breakfast
Summary: It's hard to find a suite that offers two queen beds as well as a pull out sleeper that's large and comfortable for the kids, but Embassy Suites Irvine fit the bill.  The newly renovated rooms were clean, spacious and a perfect for our family.  The front desk staff were all helpful and very friendly.  Love all the beautiful plants throughout the hotel, they really lend to the clean, fresh feeling the hotel has.  Breakfast featuring their made to order omelets was delicious, and really got our day off to a great start.  The only negatives are paying for parking and wifi, but we will be back!
Manager Response: Dear ZiggysMom.  Glad to hear the spacious two-queen room suite worked so well for your family.  We recently upgraded all the two-bed suites from doubles to queen beds for aded comfort.  We hope if you are traveling to Orange County inthe future we will be seeing you here at the Embassy Suites.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I would like to first start by thanking all staff members for their outstanding attention to details and the assistance provided by many staff members. The front desk staff were so helpful in scanning in documents for my home purchase and I could have not accomplished it with out their support! Thank You!!! The managers reception from 5:30 to 7:30pm makes for a relaxing evening after a hard days work and it is great to be called by name from the bartender and even have your drink remembered. The food at the hotel's ha'Penny Pub is up to par with any establishment in town. I have been in this hotel for almost a month straight and I can give a great feedback from my overall experiance. Day after day the whole experiance has been just wonderful. They really make you feel welcome
Manager Response: Dear Tom M.  Thank you for staying with us at the Embassy Suites Irvine and the very kind comments about the staff and their guest service.  Hope to see you back again really soon.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: Was incredibly pleased to be at this location for 5 weeks on business. Everyone on staff is pleasant, helpful, and professional. The food and beverage is oustanding, the rooms humongous and well-kept. All of these swirled together to form an oustanding atmosphere, and great experience.  Couldn't think of something I disliked if I tried.
Manager Response: Dear Elias F.  Thank you for making the Embassy Suites Irvine your home for 5 weeks.  We apprecaite your loyalty and kind comments regarding our employees guest service.  Should you be back in Orange County again hope to see you at the Hotel.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: I was "forced" to live here for 6 weeks due to traveling for work and I couldn't have picked a better hotel. Centrally located to freeways, great eats and the hotel was top notch. Quite a few nights I decided to stay in for Happy Hour and dinner and I was never disappointed with the food or service there. The bartenders and front desk staff are awesome!!!! With all the points I racked up from living there I will go back to vacation there and really get to enjoy the beaches. The only down fall was the pool and hot tub were out of service for sometime due to them installing handicap chairs so handicap people can get in/out of the pool and hot tub.
Manager Response: Dear Josh A.  Thank you for making Embassy Suites Irvine your Home Away from Home.  It's great to hear that on a long term stay the staff was able to deliver great guest service on a daily basis.  Enjoy that beach vacation using your Honors points and we hope to see you back at the Hotel on your next visit.  Best regards, Ken Director of Sales

Summary: The hotel is close to the airport  the rooms were renovated but the public areas feel old and tired. Happy hour is ok  if you are on business close by don't rent a car the hotel charges $15 per day for parking. Not wirth it with free shuttle
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Embassy Suites is very quiet and centrally located for Orange County, the airports and the major highways.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  The breakfast experience was better than at other Embassy Suites.  The food was all very carefully displayed and prepared. The afternoon reception was better too.  This hotel seems to be well managed.  We had a corner room and it was very spacious.  We had a very nice stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent Easter eve here and had a nice experience.  Very close to airport.  Only took about 5 min. on the shuttle.  Breakfast was good and thankfully out early since we had to leave at 7am and that's when breakfast was to begin.  Unlike other places I've stayed no one frowned on us hitting the line a few minutes early.  Would definatly stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently booked two rooms, one for my family and second for inlaws.  I was told that my Rooms were at ready at 4pm when I tried to check in (3pm check in time) however after simply asking what was available we immediately checked into two rooms on different floors. No problem.  Each was clean and furnishings in good repair.  My mother in law commented that the bed was much more comfortable than hers at home.    Roomservice was friendly and efficient, breakfast top notch.  Parking a little crowded, but i always found a spot.    Pool area was clean and well maintained.    Great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank You so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay, and the service received from our team. I am very pleased to see that we were able to get you into a different room type that worked for you and your family.   All of us here at the Embassy Suites value our guest, and we deeply appreciate your loyalty to our brand.    Thank you once again for your comments, and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.  Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: This is a very nice hotel.  I was first placed in a small room with only a queen bed.  I went back and asked for a suite and they moved me without any hesitation.  Suite was very nice.  Breakfast was good but staff was not prepared for the 8:45 rush.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We pulled up to this hotel to find it surrounded by police. Since we had prepaid for the hotel, we had no choice bu to stay there. Parking was blocked as there were several people hand cuffed outside and police cars blocking one of the ways in. It left it down to one way in and out which took forever to park. Once inside, no one apoligized or said don't be alarmed.  nothing like that. When going to the elevator, about 5 undercover police and the hotel manager were about to get on with us but decided to wait for the next elevator. Not very comforting to say the least. Then the next day, no one could get their cars out since no ticckets were handed out the night before. Everyone was stuck. I had to run in and get someone to come out and help everyone leave the garage causing us to
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I was very sorry to hear about the challenges you experience with our parking facility during your stay with us. As you mentioned, there was some police activity at our property on the day you checked in, but that was not something that could have been foreseen or prevented.  It was unfortunate, and bad timing all around but, our Guest safety and security is of utmost important to us and will not be compromised for any reason. But to be clear, this was not a normal occurrence and was a shock to us as well. We were very pleased to see that Irvine PD was actively working to insure that our hotel, and guest safe.   I am so very sorry for any inconvenient that was caused as a result of this, and would love to have the opportunity to discuss it further with you.    Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us with your comments, and I can assure you that we will all work extremely hard to win you back, as a fan, and loyal Guest of our property.   Please feel free to contact me with any additional comments or suggestions.   Warm Regards,  John Pease Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949 – 553 - 8332

Summary: The staff were very kind and service oriented the complete stay.Evening snacks and drinks typicall E.S. fair,plenty for everyone.The price is line with others in the area,good location and better than average breakfast.The only drawbacks 15 a day parking and its a odd setup no direct hotel access from garage. And dont forget your room key even after checkout you must have this to exit garage.And the mattress was substandard for E.S..Make sure to close your door A/c is very loud.But as far as cleanliness A+.
Manager Response: Dear Cruiserttd,  Thank You for taking the time to rate our service. I was happy to see that we were to meet your expectation with our rooms and services. I am also very excited to tell you that we will be changing our old mattresses for New ones starting at the end of April.  I have passed on your comments about our AC being loud to my Engineering Manager, so he can get his team resolve it. We also offer a few packages which include parking in the cost of the room. This is may be a option you might consider for future reservations  Your comments have been invaluable to us and I would just like to thank once again for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warm Regards,   John Pease  Front Office Manager  Embassy Suites  John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: This was our second (two-week) stay in two years and it was as delightful as the first one. This is a very well-run hotel and you feel welcome right from the time of arrival at the airport. The shuttle pick-up was on time and Mike (shuttle driver) is the best in the business. The front desk is also very professional and always helpful. Rachele did an excellent job of check-in and Robert Scarff (Manager) is the best of the best in this business ---- he's always upbeat, professional and makes sure that customers' needs are promptly met. Breakfast is also excellent and well-managed. Erick makes the best omelette ---with a smile.   Net, it's the excellence in service and personal touch that makes a hotel stand-out and keeps people coming back !! Keep it up folks.
Manager Response: Dear Ashwest,   I was a pleasure to have you back with us for a second time. Thank so much for continuing to choose our property when you have so many choices available to you.  We appreciate and value your business and loyalty, and will continue raise our bar with the hopes of exceeding your expectations and creating warm memorable experiences that will keep you coming back.   We truly appreciate your kind word about our staff and property. All of us here do our very best to make our guest feel that this is their home away from home, and I'm glad we were to do that for you and your family.  I will definitely make sure to share your comment with my team at the front office and with the other departments in the hotel as well.   Should have and additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary Heading: Front desk wasnt service oriented. I stayed at Wyndam down the street and liked that a lot better!!
Summary: Front desk service was poor. One person was nice but overall it was difficult to get their attention when they were talking amongst themselves about what they were going to eat for lunch and what they did the night before.....that experience happened three times. They really came across as if they didnt care about the guests.
Manager Response: Dear Ojai,  Thank You for taking the time to rate our service. I was very sorry to see that my  Front Office Team Fail to meet your expectation with our level of service. This is inexcusable and I will make sure that this behavior is addressed and corrected.  It is our job to make sure that every guest experience is pleasant and memorable  and we clearly dropped the ball that day. I would love to have the opportunity to speak with you, and see if there a chance that I might be able to win you back as a fan of our property.   Your comments have been invaluable to us and I would just like to thank once again for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warm Regards,   John Pease  Front Office Manager  Embassy Suites  John.Pease@hilton.com

Summary: This extremely clean, well managed hotel is five minutes from the airport and within walking distance to several nice airports. The managers reception is served out of an Irish pub inside. Only petty grievance is Ricky Bob enjoys more potatoes on top of his Shepard's Pie. Otherwise a perfect stay.
Manager Response: Dear Ricky Bob,  Thank You so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I am very pleased to see that we were able to meet and your expectation with our rooms, and amenities, and that your stay was pleasant and memorable.   We know that you have many choice when traveling, and we appreciate your business and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332  PS I'll make sure to pass on your comment about our Sheppard Pie, to my F&B manager and see if can get some more potatoes in there for you next time. I’m sure we should be able to work that out.  (^_^) lol

Summary Heading: The signs of a great hotel...
Summary: Recently I stayed here while a random pool repair was taking place.  It was annoying and I complained via TA.  Immediately, I received a message from a manager asking how the situation could be remedied.    So, this is why I think this is GREAT hotel.  I complained. They apologized.  They made it right.  Too often, properties just don't care.  This site is full of reviews of such properties.  So, I think the sign of a great hotel is one that makes as effort to make it right with the guest.    Having said that, the room, the service and the food was great.
Manager Response: Dear Have Trunks,  Thank You so much for taking the time to let us know about your stay, and the service received from our team. I am very pleased to see that we were able to spin a potential negative situation into a positive one, and find a solution that worked for you.  We truly do value you as our guest, and deeply appreciate your loyalty to our brand, and we will always look for ways to improve our service whenever possible.     Thank you once again for your comments, and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any additional comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: My wife and I stayed in this Embassy Suites hotel during an anniversary getaway from Chicago. Overall we were very pleased. The hotel was clean. Good service. And if you havent had a Pure breakfast buffet and free drink happy hour? Stay here, it is just a charm and well worth the price of stay.   Mr. and Mrs. Lion King Hazel Crest IL.
Manager Response: Dear Pokolo,  Thank You for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I am very pleased to see that we were able to meet and your expectation with our rooms, and amenities.  I'll make sure to pass on your comment about our Breakfast Buffet, and Happy Hour to my F&B manager as well. He be pleased see know that his team did their part to help make your stay enjoyable.   We all take pride in delivering excellent guest service, and creating memorable experiences for all of our guest. We appreciate your business and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Irvine, as part of a wedding block. When I first walked in I noticed that the décor is dated, this isn’t a major issue. However, when we got into our room we immediately noticed how dirty the sofa was. In fact we made a point not to sit in the “front area.”   The room looked nice, but we noticed that the inside of the cabinets were not even finished. I have stayed at much nicer hotels for the money.   They’ve also charged me for the room three times, although they do seem to be somewhat responsive to the situation. I’m still dealing with an extra $400 drawn from my account.
Manager Response: Dear Enculturation,  I was very sorry to hear about the challenges you experience with your room during your stay with us. I have followed up with our Housekeeping & Engineering Departments to have all of the room deficiencies you mentioned corrected, so they do not reoccur in the future.   Please let me know if everything has been corrected with the billing charges you mentioned and if there is still something that needs to be addressed I will have corrected immediately.   I thank you for taking the time to give us your comments and feed back about our rooms, and I can assure you that we will all working extremely hard to correct these issues and win you back, as a fan.  Please feel free to contact me with any additional comments or question you may have.   Warm Regards, John Pease Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949 – 553 - 8332

Summary Heading: Service spotty, but rooms are quiet
Summary: I ended up staying here on business because my company booked me at the last minute for a trade show at the Anaheim convention center.  This hotel is FAR, between 12 and 16 miles depending on who you ask.  But there was a show shuttle so that was good.  The check in clerk knew nothing about the shuttle service and could not answer any questions about it, even though I found out later that 60% of their occupancy was for the show.  My collegue and I took a cab to the show the first night, and we asked the hotel to call a cab for us.  It ended up being an old man and his wife in a town car with no meter who ended ip charging us $48 before the tip.  Later in the week we took a real cab back from the show to the hotel and it was only $46 including the tip.  Hmmm.  The free breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Sarah P,  Thank You for taking the time to rate our service. I was very sorry to see that we were not able to meet all of your expectation with our room during your stay. I would like to apologize for my staff not having clear and helpful information with regards to the shuttle service that was being provided by your event. I have followed up with our Housekeeping Department to make sure all of the room deficiencies you mentioned have been addressed and corrected as well, so they do not reoccur in the future.   I thank you for taking the time to give us your comments and feed back about our rooms, and I can assure you that we will all working extremely hard to make sure that none these issues repeat themselves.   Please feel free to contact me with any additional comments or question you may have.   Warm Regards,  John Pease Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949 – 553 - 8332

Summary: I joined my bf on a biz trip. His corporate rate got us a night at the Embassy Suites in Irvine.   Room: warning room 607 is a room intended for the disabled. We thought nothing of that until we took showers. The shower is made for someone in a wheel chair and we both ended up flooding the floor a good 1/2 inch. We cleaned it up twice, but the design of the shower easily floods the floor. Note the closet hanger pole is wheel chair accessible and sits maybe 3 feet off The ground.   Breakfast: who doesn't have half and half for morning tea?  This Embassy Suites doesn't have half and half. I had a freshly made omelette, pretty standard. The muffins were generic inexpensive grocery store stuff. Overall breakfast is average for an Embassy suites.   Parking: you have to walk out of
Manager Response: Dear HappyHikerGirl,  Thank You for taking the time to rate our service. I was very sorry to see that we were not able to meet your expectation with our room, or our guest services. 607 is a handicap room and I wish we would have been able to get you in a room type that better suited your needs while you were here.  I have brought up the issues you mention with the shower to my Engineering department and they are currently working on a solution to correct that problem.   I have also pointed out the F&B manager that condiments for our coffee bar need to be replaced regularly so as to avoid the shortage as you mentioned.    I realize that we failed to deliver exceptional service during your stay with us. I would love to have the opportunity to speak with you, and see if there a chance that I might be able to win you back as a fan of our property.   Your comments have been invaluable to us and I would just like to thank once again for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warmest Regards,   John Pease  Front Office Manager  Embassy Suites  John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: I never stayed at an embassy before and after this stay I will definitely be coming back,  When I checked and it was extremely easy got my key , went to my room and the room was exceptionally clean the only thing I didn't like was that my room was right in front of the elevator but we could hardly hear the noise , it was a very spacious king suite I enjoyed it.
Manager Response: Abelito 18  It was very nice to see that you enjoyed your time with us, and that our rooms and services exceed your expectations.  We appreciate your business, and we hope that you will continue to keep our hotel in mind whenever you’re in the Irvine   If should happen to think of any additional comments or suggestions you would like to mention, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warm Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: Being there is home away from home. I have told everyone about my stay at the Embass suites in Irvine .I enjoyed the services that the hotel.Breafast early morning is the best.Transportation to and from work and the airport could not have been any better.
Manager Response: Daer Carla W.  Thank You for taking the time to let us know about your stay. It was very nice to hear that you had a pleasant time with us.
