Summary: Traveling on business last week and booked here at the Embassy Suites - Irvine.  I love staying at Hilton-affiliated hotels for the double-dip, and especially at Embassy Suites chains.  The hotel itself is attractive, the front desk staff was very welcoming and friendly.  Through no fault of the hotel staff, I had reserved a non-smoking room which unfortunately had a strong smell of cigarette smoke in the bathroom when I arrived  After a quick call to the front desk, I had a service worker at my door providing a quick remedy with some good old industrial strength air freshener.  He took care of that in no time and not a hint of smoke anymore.  He also provided some complimentary snacks for my inconvenience.  Very nice.  My room otherwise was clean and comfortable.  The Manager's
Manager Response: Dear GK360,  Thank You for taking the time to let us know about your stay. It sound as if you had a pretty nice time at our property overall, and I am very happy to see that we were able to meet your expectation with our guest room, and hotel amenities.   I would also like to thank you for your feedback. It helps us to continue doing all the things that you like, and get rid of the things that you don't.   I look forward to your next visit in the near future, and if you should have any comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and this one was the best. Check-in took all of one minute. The room was perfect. The gym on the property had all the best equipment and the pool/jacuzzi was very clean. We had the cook to order breakfast and service was very fast with the food being excellent. This property has a Irish Bar inside as well. I would highly recommend this property if you are staying in the area of John Wayne Airport
Manager Response: Dear Tjl3909,  Thank You for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to exceed your expectation with our guest room, and hotel amenities. My F&B Manager will pleased to hear that that you were happy with our "cook to order" breakfast as well.    Maintaining your loyalty is very important to us which is why we love getting feedback from our guest. It helps us to continue doing the things that work, and change the things that don't, and we couldn't do it without you, so thank you once again for your comments.   I hope that you continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area, and please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: I had a concern over paying for parking for HHilton Honors members. It is usually $15, but was reduced to $5 because of my employer. I believe it should be free for members. In discussing with hotel manager, she was very belligerent. When I asked for the regional managers name, she REFUSED to provide it.  To get rid of me she comped my parking and reduced my bill per night. This is not what I wanted. I wanted to discuss the policy in general. Then she threatened to call my employee and get them involved. Intimidation !!  I could see I was getting nowhere, so left and emailed a complaint to Embassy, who promptly dismissed it as policy. They asked me to get back to them with any questions which I did. Yes, I was ignored.  I have stayed in this hotel chain all over the world, and
Manager Response: My Dear Valued Guest,   First let me say that I am truly sorry for the way this situation was handled. We should have been able to resolve your parking inquiries and meet all of your expectations without an problem.  I'm sorry that did not happen. I have shared your comments with all of my managers, so that type of problem does not reoccur in the future.  It is never an acceptable practice to have our guest leave feeling unsatisfied without hotel, employees, or services.   We do pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service, and we do realize that we failed to deliver that to you during your stay with us. I would like to have the opportunity to discuss this further with you, and hopefully win you back as a Fan of our property.     Once again, I like to thank you for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warmest Regards,   John Pease  Front Office Manager  Embassy Suites  John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary Heading: Convenient location, clean rooms, great breakfast!
Summary: I stayed here b/c it was conveniently located to the airport and the place I had to work.  The breakfast was good and they had great options, I always enjoy the manager's special after a long day at work, and the rooms were clean and the bed really comfortable.  I also loved the desk space - plenty of room, light, and the chair was comfortable.  Great place to be when you have to be away from home!
Manager Response: Dear Jamie S.  I would like to thank you for your very kind, about our property, and services. Summary Heading: great free breakfast and clean room but pay for room wifi
Summary: great free breakfast and clean room but pay for room wifi.  Very close to airport in a safe cortorate environment.  Dont waste your time trying to eat in the bar - pool service there.  Go to El Torito's a block away for great service and fresh mex.

Summary: Just had my first stay at this hotel for a business meeting.  I have to say from the moment I walked in the door to the day I checked out it was a wonderful experience.   Extremely clean suites and a personable staff through out the hotel.  Love the complimentary breakfast and happy hour tidbits available to everyone.   Beautiful setting available for all rooms to see. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan on staying here again soon!
Manager Response: Dear Snap4710,  My name is John Pease, Front Office Manager for the Embassy Suites in Irvine.  I would like to thank you for your kind words, and for taking the time to rate our property, and services. Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Hotel Irvine-Orange County Airport
Summary: “It has an excellent breakfast. The Happy Hour is better than most Embassy Suites. But, the price is the most expensive”  Although the hotel is the most expensive in that area, it provides a complementary cooked-to-order breakfast and a good happy hour.  Therefore, it still has the best value.  The Atrium area has a nice indoor expensive palm trees and excellent lighting besides a small waterfall. However, this Embassy Suite has no koi fishes living in the man-made small lake with a traditional Embassy Style waterfall, such as Embassy Suite, Santa Ana.  On the other hand, it has a nice saltwater tank near the guest elevators.  The swimming pool is smaller than most Embassy Suites.  Cautions: The area around the swimming pool and SPA is very dangerous because the tile floors are
Manager Response: Dear JeremyNorthridge  Thank you for your very kind, and well thought out comments about our property, and services.  I am very pleased that you were happy with our happy hour, and breakfast, as well as the other amenities and decor our property offers. You will be happy to know that we have resurfaced our pool area flooring correcting that danger you mentioned. It is now a slip free floor, thank you for pointing that out.     Your comments and feedback are very helpful and important to us as we do pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service.   We hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area, and please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future. Summary: A beautiful hotel and comfortable and clean rooms convenient to businesses in the area. Area is safe and well lighted. Breakfast and happy hour are free and very good! Parking is a little inconvenient to hotel access, but protected and secure. Unfortunately ice makers on (2) floors were not working! Internet is charged, but was waived. (3) elevators very little wait. Availability of electrical outlets adequate Refrigerator coffee maker in room. Staff is helpful and friendly Facilites are fantastic!
Manager Response: Dear James C  Thank You for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I am very pleased to see that we were able to meet and your expectation with our rooms, and amenities.  We have corrected the problem with our Ice machine on the 2nd floor that you mentioned, and we will continue to monitor it to insure it continues to function properly.   We take pride in delivering excellent guest service, and creating memorable experiences for all our guest because we know that you have many choices when selecting a hotel, and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary Heading: Good for a family Disney trip
Summary: Ken at the hotel helped us with a scheduling mistake.  He was awesome.  He overcame the issue and we were completely satisfied.    We had read some previous reviews about loud former union employees showing up and giving hotel guests an early morning unwanted wake ups from outside the hotel(What nerve, they act like children and give themselves a worse rap).  No noise while we were there in mid November.  Breakfast was nice, as usual.  Rooms were nice and clean, as usual.  For the price, we have no complaints.  It was great for what we needed.  A place close to a freeway and to Disneyland.  Whole Foods was nearby for our snacking pleasure.  Target, restaurants and movie theater are all close too.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  My name is John Pease, Front Office Manager for the Embassy Suites in Irvine.  I would like to thank you for your kind words about our property, and services. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to meet or exceed your expectation.  Your loyalty is very important to us and we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service. We hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.  Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332   PS: I’ll make sure to pass on to Ken how pleased you were with his help.   Thanks Again.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at Airport-Adjacent Irvine Embassy Suites
Summary: For a weekend family visit, I opted for this airport-adjacent hotel.  The Embassy Suites offered free airport pickup and a "suite" hotel room.  I recommend this hotel.  It's in the atrium style, with a free happy hour and free cooked-to-order (you can have an omelet) breakfast. Although not many restaurants were within walking distance (I didn't rent a car), the El Torito Grill was surprisingly good, with an excellent Sunday brunch. Michele, the hotel "hospitality ambassador" was so gracious, charming, and kind enough to give me a ride to visit the local mall.  This is a good value, but be aware that without a car it is somewhat isolated.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your kind words about our Hotel, Staff and Services. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to  meet all of your expectation. Guest like you and your family are always a pleasure to take care of, and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.   Please contact me the next time you’re planning to visit us and I'll make sure that our Housekeeping Manager has towel available for purchase. Thank you once again for your comments, and should have any additional suggestions, please let me know.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease Front Office Manager Embassy Suites Irvine (949) 553-8332

Summary Heading: Great option for a family to stay for Disneyland vacation
Summary: This hotel really exceeded my expectations.  I had given up on ES because so many we had stayed at were old and noisy.  But my husband had frequent stay points which allowed us to stay here free for 5 days for a family of 6.  Naturally, I couldn't turn it down.   Turns out, we really liked it and were very satisfied with the hotel.  The room was clean and roomy, the beds comfortable and the bathroom very clean, with plenty of big fluffy towels.  Good internet connection, too.  We really enjoyed the cook to order breakfast (free!).  So much excellent food.  They even had different specials every day, fresh fruit and great service.  Each of my kids had several plates each morning, and the staff kept cheerfully picking up the plates.  The parking felt very safe in an enclosed
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our Hotel. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to  meet and exceed your expectation or rooms, and the amenities we offer.   We hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area, and please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: December 29-31, 2012 Internet/Staff:  Upon arrival I asked about internet service. Was told that I was not at the level for free internet. I asked how many more points or nights would I have to have to attain the level for free internet. I was told "I don't know". I asked if internet could be comped. He said "I'll talk to my manager, he was joking around with you at check in." I told him that I like staying at Embassy Suites & it is always my first choice. Throughout my 3 night stay, paying for two rooms, I was not contacted either way, yes or no to comping internet service. How the situation could have been handled was to contact me and discuss options to attain a higher member level.  I also know that comping small services is at the discretion of each manager. My feeling
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to rate our services. We realize that your time is very valuable, and we appreciate you giving us your feedback. I am very sorry to see that we were not able to meet all of your expectation with our room, and internet services, or the way in which your question were answered during your stay.  We have also taken note of the other issue you pointed out such as: “the bath towels not being in your room” and we will be working extremely hard to see that does not reoccur in the future.    Once again, I like to thank you for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary Heading: Great breakfast, room clean but small
Summary: I liked this hotel, close to everything.  Rooms were nice but small, some of the finishing touches were missing and incomplete with the remodel.  Food was excellent, staff was very nice. Parking is a little expensive, noise levels were high because of the atrium. Great to have laudry facilities at the resort.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank You for taking the time to rate our services. I am sorry to see that we were not able to meet all of your expectation with our room during your stay, and we have taken note of the areas you pointed out, and we will be working extremely hard to see that they are brought up to standard, and hopefully we will be able to meet and exceed your expectations in the future.   Once again, I like to thank you for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly @ John.Pease@hilton.com, or call me @ 949-553-8332.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: Do not stay here! I made a reservation for a 2room suite and upon arrival was given a 1room. I was under the impression that there were nomore however, i was given the room i paid for. Basically they wanted me to pay the price of a 2room suite but stay in a 1room studio. ANother disappointment was the fact that the set of keys given to our room didnt work and had to wait for the right set to be given. The final straw was that the spa was NOT HOT! grr. i spefically wanted to stay here bc of their indoor spa.SMH Never again
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank You for taking the time to rate our property. I am sorry to hear that we were not able to meet all of your expectation with our room during your stay. I see that you booked a 2 room suite, which means a living room area, and a separate sleeping area. It does not mean 2 sleeping rooms. I'm very sorry for the confusion and a see how you may have come to that conclusion, and we will make sure that our rooms’ description is detailed a little more clearly to prevent this type of misunderstanding from reoccurring again in the future. We have also taken note of the areas you mentioned, and corrected them so they are now up to standard.   Once again, I like to thank you for your feedback, and should you have any additional comments, or suggestions, please feel free to contact me directly @ John.Pease@hilton.com, or call me @ 949-553-8332.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: The room was outstanding with separate bedroom and living room.  Well appointed and clean.  The service was good except no wash clothes the second day.  The issue was the restaurant in the evening.  The breakfast is an exceptional buffet with made to order eggs, french toast, etc. Lots to choose from and well done.  We had done a pre-order for dinner on January 1st.  Came into the restaurant and it took 45 minutes to receive two salads.  Restaurant manager was finally called and got the salads delivered.  He, in my opinion, needs to be more visable in the restaurant.  We had asked three servers about the order, given them our name and order and were told each time it was coming. They were not busy so it was not the issue with too many customers.  Asked about why they were not
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank You for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to me or exceed your expectation with our room, and breakfast buffet. We have taken note of the items you pointed out with our restaurant service, and we will be working extremely hard to see that they are brought up to standard, and hopefully we will be able to meet and exceed your expectations in the future in those areas as well.   Your loyalty is very important to us and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.  Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: I am a huge fan of Embassy Suites.   I always feel like I am getting my money's worth with the large room, manager reception and included breakfast.  This added value goes a long way with me, especially since we have had less than memorable experiences with other hotels that charge 2X as much for much, much less.  This Embassy Suites in Irvine was very nice, clean and modern.  The breakfast area was very pleasant and the restaurant bar looked fun.  We stayed on the first floor and surprisingly, it was incredibly quiet in the bedroom.  Overall, great experience!  We will stay there again.  I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest  My name is John Pease, Front Office Manager for the Embassy Suites in Irvine. I would like to thank you for your kind words about our property, and services. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to meet or exceed your expectation with our rooms, breakfast, and managers’ reception.   Your loyalty is very important to us and we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service. We hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any additional comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: Rooms are actually 2-room suites. The rooms are clean, large and comfortable. The included hot breakfast is one of the best. Hotel amenities are excellent. The staff is exceptionally friendly and makes the stay very enjoyable. This is one of the better values we have experienced. There are lots of families because of it's proximity to Disneyland. The hotel is about three blocks away from two strip-malls, but in most cases (like most of LA) you will want a car.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I am very pleased to hear that we were able to exceed your expectation with our rooms, and amenities. We take pride in delivering exceptional service, and creating fun and memorable experiences.  We know that you have many choices when selecting a hotel, and we hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area.    Please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary: Amazing staff at check-in, very professional. He looked like the manager, training a fine young man also at the desk. Went up to the room, it was very clean- thank housekeeping from our part. Enjoyed the evening Manager's Reception, staff kept the area very clean. Everado is a friendly spirit, we enjoyed his presence there. He asked if everything was great, it was so. Excellent facility, we can't wait to return again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your kind words about our staff, rooms, and services. I am very pleased to hear that we were able to either meet or exceed your expectation.  We take pride in delivering exceptional service, and creating a fun and safe environment for our guest.   We hope that you will continue to make our hotel your first your choice whenever you’re in the Irvine area, and please feel free to contact me with any comments, or suggestions you may have in the future.   Warmest Regards,  John Pease  Front Office Manager Embassy Suites John.Pease@hilton.com  949-553-8332

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience. Clean rooms,  elegant decor, quiet hallways, and an outstanding free breakfast.
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and spacious. The large living room, and king sized bed room were well decorated. A huge semi kitchen area was appreciated. The made to order omelets were delicious.  I would highly recommend Embassy Suites to anyone staying in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here from December 21, 2012 to December 26, 2012.  The rooms were very comfortable and the breakfast is excellent!  They had practically everything you could imagine for breakfast food.  The beds were comfortable and the rooms were a reasonable size.  Only had a few small complaints.  The first is was the temperature in the fitness room.  When I worked out the first time I told the front desk how warm it was in there and they said they would look into it.  Went to workout a few days later and found the thermostat and it was set to 79.  So the thermostat worked fine, but set to way to high of a temperature.  There was no fans in the room either.  The room next to it has a pool and jacuzzi so I can see keeping that room warmer but not sure why they need the fitness
Manager Response: none

Summary: We utilized the park here and fly reservation option of the Embassy Suites Irvine.  We parked our car in their covers parking while we flew to Ft.Lauderdale, Fl., and left our car for a week while we traveled.  Great deal, stay a night and parking is included.  Arrived at the hotel and received an outstanding and friendly check in.  received an excellent room which was roomy and equipped with many amenities.  In the evening we attended the managers reception and enjoyed a glass of wine and some cheese and crackers along with a variety of other foods available for us to enjoy.  The next morning we enjoyed an outstanding breakfast which included made to order omelets.   We then proceeded to check out .  Check out was easy and fast.  W utilized the hotels shuttle service to the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great business hotel close to John Wayne airport
Summary: I moved over to this hotel after a disappointing stay at the nearby Hilton. The Embassy Suites is about a mile from the airport which makes it very convenient but far enough away that you don't have the loud plane noise. The staff was professional and welcoming. I had one minor housekeeping issue that the front desk took care of right away.   The room was the the typical Embassy Suites layout of two rooms with a microwave and mini-frig. The bathroom had been fully updated and was good sized. Plenty of nice towels and Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries were a nice amenity. The bed had a very comfortable mattress and pillows.  I didn't eat the free breakfast (it smelled great in the morning though) or utilize the work out facility/pool. I did use the complimentary shuttle to get to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here several times.  Great location, close to John Wayne airport, South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island/Newport Beach. Only 90 min from San Diego and easy drive to Temecula wineries  or Disneyland.  Love the free breakfast... Makes the hotel an even better value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was impressed with this hotel from the moment I walked in. The lobby was clean and spacious. The atrium was huge as is common for Embassy Suites.   My room was large, everything just as it should be. The bed was comfortable, there were 6 pillows on the bed.   The bathroom was stocked with towels, everything was spotless. I found nothing out of place in this room!   Room service was a slight problem, I ordered tea, they only had two choices, green or Lipton. The dessert I ordered was divine. An apple cobbler with vanilla icecream. The meal I ate in the pub inside the hotel was a shepherd's pie. This was an odd meal. It was decent, but not excellent. The shepherd's pie consisted of blandly spiced chunks of beef, a skimpy amount of mashed potatoes.  The housekeeping staff was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Acceptable, could use some refurb and stop the cruelty to the fish
Summary: ****  Before I review the hotel, I need to say that having a fish tank that receives fluorescent light 24 hours of the day is dreadful for the inhabitants.  You may not care about fish, but those who do understand that they need night and day like the rest of us, and the lobby tank is just gruesome for those who believe we should be kind to other creatures.  Moving on ....  Booked late and was checked in promptly and kindly by night front desk staff.  Hotel overall is well lit, cheerful and has a decent "vibe" ...   PARKING IS NOT AT ALL CONVENIENT.  If you have trouble walking or simply don't fancy a 200 yard walk, you may wish to select another hotel.  Typical layout for ES.  As previously mentioned, housekeeping here has knocked themselves out, and the rooms are neither small
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites is by far the best hotel.
Summary: The Manager's reception and full breakfast are the perfect ways to start and end a hectic day. Very spacious rooms and the staff at this Embassy was on point the whole stay. If I had one suggestion it would be include the locally brewed beer in the Manager's reception.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in a suite for 3 nights with some friends and siblings to go to Disneyland (a ~15 min drive away) and the location, service and accomidations were wonderful. The room was big and the beds were comfortable, but the best part was the breakfast! No dinky continental breakfast here...They had a full omlett bar, cooked to order pancakes and french toast, and all the sausage and bacon you could ever want. This saved us a TON of hassel and cash and we took full advantage of it every morning.   The best service came from the housekeeping manager, when i had realized my little brother left his jacket hanging in the closet (still wet from splash mountain) I called and not only did they offer to ship it out to me (i paid for the shipping) but he said he would wash and dry it first!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are Embassy Suites fans and on previous visits to the area had always used the Embassy Suites on Dyer in the former sugar factory location but had become disenchanted there and decided to try this newer facility.  We were not disappointed and will definitely use this hotel in the future. Everything about our stay was great.  Check-in and staff were quick, friendly and efficient.  Our room was on the 10th floor, had a nice view and was very quiet as well as comfortable.  The morning complimentary breakfast offering was well done and the amount and quality of seating was better than any other Embassy Suites hotel we have stayed in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed in several Embassy Suites throughout California and were beginning to lose faith in Embassy.  This hotel made us re-think our stance on Embassy Suites. (we had decided to add them to our DO NOT STAY list prior to this stay)  Pro's: Spacious, more current furnishings and decor, comfortable bed, great breakfast, organized breakfast (other embassy breakfasts are a free for all disaster) nice front desk staff, with our room and deal we purchased we had free wifi, free parking, close to 405 freeway, close to John Wayne airport.    Con's: Furniture could use a good steam cleaning.  At first glance they look good, but when looking closer you can tell they need to be cleaned.  Tile grout could use a spruce up, wifi kept losing signal.   All in all we were impressed and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful hotel located close to shopping and great dining. Quiet and very pleasant hotel. Great free breakfast buffet and managers reception daily. Close access to John Wayne Airport and 405 freeway. Buisness center of Irvine close and convienient.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel in beautiful area of California with all you need nearby
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel.  Nice clean rooms and friendly staff.  It is close to everything you need, great shopping, beaches, restaurants, airport, and business meeting locations.  I highly recommend the Newport Beach and Balboa island area.  We also really enjoyed fashion island.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to Hwy 405, this has easy access to many OC attractions - Disneyland, etc.  This is an atrium-style hotel with glass elevators & exposed interior walkways pass living room windows.  Friendly staff, incredibly generous free breakfast buffet with fruits, cereals, muffins, & hot dishes (scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes) as well as omelettes cooked to order.  Fast wi-fi.  Covered parking in a multi-story garage is nearby but not attached.  Rooms are big, comfortable beds. TV w/HBO in living room & BR.  "Manager's afternoon Happy Hour" has free wine, beer, some chips & crackers & maybe nachos.  My only complaint is that the living room sofa (bed) upholstery fabric has either worn very unevenly or was terribly soiled.  I didn't sit on it or use it - put the extra blanket over it
Manager Response: none

Summary: What more can one say about this hotel that you haven't already read here. The rooms are nice, spacious and clean. Friendly staff. Lightning quick check-in. I actually got this room at a fantastic rate through Priceline. So, that amps my excitement about this hotel. Very nice dining area with a fountain & greenery. Free breakfast was fantastic. They had an omelet bar - which is pretty great. I won't let a couple of loud protesters take away from my hotel experience, but yes, they should say something when you check in. I would definitely stay here again. Great hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed over the weekend of Oct. 13th for one night. I got the room for an amazing price through a group-on promotion. Staff was amazingly friendly in check-in and out process and made it super easy. It was a beautiful hotel and and easy to find. They had just remodeled and it made the hotel feel like you were somewhere other than in the middle of downtown Irvine. The room was extremely well cleaned and remodeled. We appreciated having a kitchenette in the room because with three women the one bathroom with a mirror in the morning isn't enough. There are mirrors throughout the room which made it very nice. Lots of lighting and electrical outlets for all of us to plug in and not fight over plugs. Also as a bonus there was a pullout Queen sized bed in the couch which was very
Manager Response: none

Summary: My Wife and had been planning a week in Tahoe, but do to family issues had to settle for a weekend away. So we had high hopes for our two night stay. We were not disappointed. The property is very nice. Everything was sparkling clean.  Our King suite was very nice, comfy and quiet. The indoor landscaping and waterfalls made it seam like paradise. The soft mood music added to the feel. The Staff was very professional and helpful. They have an indoor pool, but since it is indoors, it is not as relaxing or pretty as the rest of the hotel. The smell of chlorine was pretty strong. We actually got a Groupon deal that was extremely reasonable. It included free parking & Wi-Fi. The free breakfast was great and plentiful. It was so relaxing to eat in the Atrium area Even though this
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel. Staff was beyond nice from housekeeping, front desk to breakfast staff. Breakfast was great as always. My family always loves when we choose the Embassy. Only 10-15 minutes from New port beach. We were able to just grab dinner and head to the beach for an hour or so. great place
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I have just spent another night in the Embassy Suites Hotel in Irvine and, like our previous visit last year, we found it to be an excellent hotel. We stay in the hotel the night before departing from the nearby John Wayne airport and make use of their free shuttle service to the airport. We wake up refreshed after a good nights sleep, Have a very nice breakfast in the hotel, and then catch the shuttle to the airport. It takes all the hassle out of getting to our plane on time.  The hotel has great facilities, great food, friendly and helpful staff, and the rooms are large and very comfortable. This is a beautiful hotel and excellent value for money.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: got the Presidential Suite, very comfortable
Summary: My family stayed here for the weekend since the Santa Ana location was already booked. We were given the Presidential Suite at the top floor. Very well appointed and so comfortable (parents are HHonors members obviously). Not much more needs to be said other than having a great nice sleep with a very nice LED TV to watch.  Also, breakfast and snacks were provided just like at all other ES locations, so always a plus. ES Irvine definitely is probably one of the flagship hotels for the chain I'm pretty sure, based on how nice it is...only thing is that many families were in town and were staying here as well, so there were many youngins roaming around.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 1st time at Embassy Suites, very nice!
Summary: We stayed here a couple weekends ago and we were very impressed. Nice hotel, nice rooms, friendly staff, free happy hour drinks and free breakfast buffet. The room we stayed in had a king bed with a separate living room area.  We will definately stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms have been renovated and were nice.  The bed was great and allowed a good night sleep until the protestors wake you up at about 6 am in the morning.  I was on the 10th floor but they were marching down below at the entrance with bullhorns which made it very loud.  I asked what all the noise was when I checked out and a visibly annoyed front desk clerk told me it was people that want the hotel to unionize.  This is fine but I think the hotel can be a little nicer about it and maybe warn guests that this is happening.  The hot water in the sink barely had any pressure was my only other issue.  They normally charge $15 a night to park and the garage is situated oddly to the back side of the hotel but due to some construction they didn't charge during my stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall, this is a very nice property. The room was very comfortable, although the air conditioning was noisy and seemed to operate independently of the thermostat. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. The only glitch was the internet charge. Really? $200 for a room and you can't throw in free wi-fi access? I needed  15 minutes of access, but the only way to get it was to buy a whole day. Not worth it. This is the only hotel I've stayed at recently that didn't have free wi-fi.  On the plus side, the included breakfast buffet was excellent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was travelling with my wife, 5 year old son and 19 year old sister in law on a 4 night stay. The rooms are great and the pull out sofa mattress was actually a memory faom mattress and was comfortable.  Pros: Really close to the I-405 and CA-55. 3 minutes from SNA. Exellent central location. Breakfast was great. Cons: AC could not reach 69F. Not enough dresser space in bedroom or living room. Need to add a trash can in the bedroom. Parking was a little steep at $15 a night.  Overall, it was a nice experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed on a Saturday night in September.  We were in town for a Saturday night cross country race with my son's team.  The hotel is conveniently located, and fairly modern.  The rooms were more spacious than some Embassy Suites we have visited.  Considering the above-average (for a hotel) breakfast, the place was a great value.  I would highly recommend it if you need someplace to stay for a weekend trip with kids.  The only real problem was rooms were not ready on time, when some of the other families we traveled with arrived.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with my wife and 1-year old twins.  We booked a "Standard Double Suite".  Based on the room description we expected to have a double bed and a living room area where we would put the babies portable cribs at night.  When we arrived we were informed by Alex at the front desk that sometimes a "Standard Double Suite" is another term for a "Double Bed Non-Suite Studio" and that is what we booked.  There was a soccer tournament in town as well as a business convention so the hotel was booked solid.  I can completely understand that, but to be told that sometimes a "Standard Double Suite" really means a "Double Bed Non-Suite Studio" is insulting.  We have stayed at other Embassy Suites frequently when we travel and every other "Standard Double Suite" in the country has
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights for a business convention, and had no issues. Room was clean and very comfortable. Staff was helpful & friendly. Breakfast was good with a large variety to pick from. Airport shuttle makes it convenient and quick, and they will also take you to other places within a 3 mile (I believe) area, one of them being the South Coast Mall.  Enjoyed our stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for an extended business trip. Typical Embassy Suite breakfast and Happy hour, nothing new there. This hotel is very popular with the out of town soccer families. Be prepared to deal with an extremely packed breakfast area on the weekends. Plus a lot the kids run wild through out the hotel, with management doing nothing. We had to call security when trying to workout due to several kids running in and out of the exercise area.  Also there was water flowing on the hardwoods in the exercise room...according to maintenance, it was coming from the kitchen. Kids also were unsupervised in the pool and the spa areas taking over both places.  Also there is a union protesting out front every morning with bull horns, make sure you get a back middle room. We were told nothing could
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location - close to many OC attractions
Summary: My friends and family like to stay at this Embassy Suites any time we plan a trip to Orange County.  It is conveniently located right off the the 405 and 55 freeway and John Wayne/Orange county airport.   Compared to the Embassy Suites a few miles down, this location has been through a recent renovation.  The room is always clean, same with the rest of the facility.  Free wi-fi always available in your room. Breakfast is still served in the morning with plenty selection and eating space.  This time around we took advantage of their happy hour snacks before heading out for dinner (nacho cheese, tortilla chips, animal crackers, gold fish crackers and drinks).    About a mile down from the hotel there is an AMC/shopping/eating plaza and about 2 miles in the opposite direction,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay at renovated Embassy Suites - Irvine
Summary: This is the best Embassy Suites that I ever stayed with.. Great location and the upgrade facility.  They offered a great 1 bedroom king sized bed suite with hot breakfast and afternoon management's receptions (free drink and snacks).  The room has a sitting room with a queen sized sofa bed, a nice 40 inch Samsung HD TV, a working desk, a microwave, a small refrigerator and a small sink.  Nice updated bathroom with sets of nice towels.  A nice king sized bed with 40 inch Samsung HD TV.   I like the experience that they have hot breakfast, ready to order all kinds of omelet or eggs of your choice, choice of toasts, fruit, sausages, bacon, potatoes, pancakes and etc.  Nice parking facility.  They offer alcoholic drinks or others in the afternoon with great snacks.  This is really a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No TV, no power, no internet!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel Aug 2012. When we checked in, there was no TV signal. Then, there was a power outage so there was no aircondition and the room got very hot. When we drove out of the parking, there were young  men who came from a noisy hotel event fighting in the parking lot, so we could not get out because they blocked the parking. I called the hotel to send security but the person who picked up could not understand what I was saying and the security guards never came. This is what we pay $15 for to park?! We finally were able to get out to get food, but could not find the hotel on the way back because the sign was not lit. That night and the following morning, there was still no internet even after power came back on, rendering my trip to OC useless because I could not
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for two nights. We arrived on Friday night and the room we were in the air condition did not work. The room was up to 85 degress. The front desk could not put us in another room because they said the hotel was booked., They sent up a guy that could not fix the problem, the front desk told me that maintenance was gone for the night and we would have to wait until the morning to get it fixed. Their solution was to bring us a fan. The fan the brought to our room was dirty and Hugh! The fan must have been from the kitchen, it smelled of oil and had grease all over it. When we turned it on it blew out a nasty smell of grease. The fan was so loud we could not keep it on.  In the morning we requested to talk to a manager about the issue. He apologized and that
Manager Response: none

Summary: I don't usually write reviews, but felt compelled after my last nights stay. I planned a night out with the wife, and got tickets to the comedy club at the Irvine Spectrum (about 10 miles away). I chose to stay at this hotel and was beyond satisfied. I thought this hotel was outstanding, especially considering the price. I paid about $150 (including the parking fee). This included a very nice, clean and comfortable suite (2 rooms, 2 TVs, couch, fridge, microwave, and nice bathroom) on the 8th floor with a nice view. The hotel has a simple layout with easy access to the elevators. The room includes happy hour at the bar from 5 to 7 pm (drinks included in the price of the room), and an outstanding made to order breakfast until 1030 am. What a value! How does the Embassy Suites
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: nice atrium, good for business, but poor choice for families
Summary: Disappointing example of the chain. Looks better on the web site than in practice. The atrium areas is bright and airy, and the highlight of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and functional for business users, but less suitable for families than other suite hotels. Usual Embassy offering of free breakfast and manager's free drinks, both of which are useful if you have time to exploit these. The indoor pool and so-called sun terrace were very disappointing, both small and not so clean. We also experience a few problems with the maid service, such as too few towels, failure to replenish coffee, tea and cups etc. There is a basic bar and restaurant on site, and across the street a few chain restaurants, but beware as all of these close very early because this is a business
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 2 nights for business. Hotel seems to be recently updated. I did have a few minor issues. When I arrived the room was probably at least 78 degrees. I cranked the thermostat down and the room never cooled below 75 for the 2 nights I was there. AC never turned off either. Killed a spider in the bathroom. Bath towels and washcloths didn't seem clean (hair, makeup stain) and one was ripped. Parking garage was kind of inconvenient in relation to the hotel. No inside entrance from the garage. Be prepared to pay $15 a night for parking!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a wonderful hotel. New renovations. Hotel looks great. Our room was so comfortable. Bed was great, bathroom was large and water pressure was to die for. We were next to the stairs and over the breakfast area (RM 204)....could not hear anything. VERY quiet. Hotel staff was a joy to work with, the food service workers were friendly and happy. Only stayed one night but left relaxed. IF We ever return to O.C. we will stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Breakfast was great, hotel staff were helpful and courteous, room was clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay again. Only drawbacks were the parking is in the back and a pain to get to if you have children, and because all the corridors face into an atrium, the noise from the bar at the bottom goes all the way to the top of the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not All Rooms Suites. Standard Embassy Suites.
Summary: We stayed only one night here in July 2012 and we relatively pleased with the hotel. Here is a list of pros and cons: Pros  1- The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, as expected. When we asked for extra pillows and blankets we received them quickly, and more than we asked for. The breakfast staff was very friendly as well. 2- The breakfast is good and met the standard set by other Embassy Suites. The food variety was good and the area was clean, although busy. It was somewhat tough to find a place to sit and eat. 3- The location of this hotel is very good, with close access to businesses, airport, freeways and shopping. Easy to get in and out of the hotel. Guests facing the front of the hotel cannot avoid this disturbing wake up call;  I know, I was one of them.    The front desk staff informed me the protestors are pro-union agitators who dislike the hotel's non-union policies.  In fact, some of the them are actual hotel employees! Also both times we noticed large number of teenagers who seemed to be coming in multiple cars to "party."  They were definitely not guests and only one car had room key to get into parking garage which they ran from car to car.  Understand management only has so much control but if a random guest like me can see clearly what is going on, I don't think it would be too hard for the staff or loss prevention to realize.  Anyway, rooms are always very clean and comfortable.  Buffet breakfast is

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel - enjoyed our stay
Summary: Stayed in a King suite. The bedroom is enclosed and separate from the living room area which was equipped with a sofa bed, refrigerator, microwave and bar sink,  television and desk. The suite was very clean, and the furniture was up to date. We stayed 4 nights, and the second night the bar sink faucet began  to drip. I called down to reception, and within 15 minutes a repairman was at the door. Very prompt service. The front desk staff were also very courteous and helpful.  Breakfast was included, and you could order an omelette (with a wide choice of ingredients), eggs your choice, bacon, sausages, cereal, fruits, or pastry. They put me in a room that was in a private hallway of sorts, with another room sharing the hallway.  The room was more like an oversized closet than a hotel room.  I had the noise of the guests who were staying in the other room accessible from the private hallway, and the were constantly going in and out of their room, with the door slamming each time.  Another adjoining room to me must have shared the vents from my bathroom, as I could easily hear every word they spoke.  I could also smell cigarette smoke. Summary Heading: Pleasing to the most picky guest!
Summary: Stayed here friday and Saturday nights for a nearby soccer tournament.  Perfect all the way around from the front desk help to the super clean room to the fantastic breakfast included.  Would recommend even to my mother-in-law!  Just know there's a fee to park in the nearby convenient parking garage.

Summary Heading: Nice Embassy Suites with a few small problems
Summary: I have stayed here a number of times on business and I have always been happy with everything - except the parking and fitness center.  Parking is in an adjacent parking deck with tiny spaces.  Its a bit of a walk back to the hotel with part of the walk uncovered.  The gym has some broken equipment in it and is quite small.  That being said, its still my favorite hotel in the immediate area.  The king suite is large, comfortable, and well appointed.  The beds are very comfortable.  No issues getting to sleep.  The complimentary breakfast and evening reception are wonderful.  My company pays the bills for these trips and we get a corporate rate, so I can't really speak to the value at full price.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Even better Customer Service"

This particular property is very clean, well-located especially for business, and gives wonderful guest service.  I had a billing challenge that over the following 3 days was attended to with the professionalism and concern you'd expect from a Four Seasons.   Also, when I asked the front desk about the hours of 2 nearby restaurants she picked up the phone and called both of them while I was standing there.  Negatives?  No outdoor pool and while the new, energy efficient lighting is great for the "green industry" it's dreadful if you care how your make-up looks. Morning breakfast is quite the spread and managers receptions includes drinks and snacks each night.  I typically use the small but adequate fitness room as well as a nice indoor whirlpool when staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: We got a room for our friends here and we are fully satisfied

Summary: I was in Irvine over the weekend and stayed at the Embassy Suites.  For $99.00 a night, the king bed suite was a great value for the money.  Not included, $15.00 a night for parking. Summary: Clean comfy room. Very good breakfast. Fee for parking. Not one of the bigger properties, but suites are good size. Very close to restaurants and malls. Definitely recommend.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Excellent Service... and Breakfast was good too!

What we didn't realize is that the shuttle would take us anywhere within 3 miles!  The front desk was very accommodating and the drivers were extremely friendly and helpful.  We ended up not getting a rental car- we didn't need one! Many great restaurants are also within walking distance.  The breakfast was great as well. Summary Heading: Above Average Embassy Suites near SNA Airport

Friendly staff at check-in  Bad 1.  Only one set of elevators - long walk to the room. 2. Summary Heading: One of the Nicer Embassy Suites
Summary: I stayed for 2 weeknights at the Embassy Suites in Irvine on a business trip. The service was superb, from the people behind the desk, to the cleaning staff, to the bartender at the Manager's Reception -- daily  from 5:30 to 7:30 featuring an open bar in the beautiful open atrium. Summary: I recently stayed a week at the Embassy Suites in Irvine with family and must say that the hotel only enhanced the overall experience. The indoor pool is only around 30 feet long and the faint smell of chlorine is in the lobby. The best thing is happy hour next door (unfortunately, it ends at 6:30pm) at McCormick & Schmick’s, lots of good food for $2 each.  I recommend this hotel to people who just need a short stay.  Do the Priceline for $50 and not more.  It’s not a type of hotel you enjoy to stay; the INDOOR pool is VERY small and same as the gym.  We are disappointed about the indoor pool in sunny CA!
